rationale: HPI notes that patient lives alone, forgets refills, and reports fatigue, but does not mention inconsistent pill-organizer use; otherwise concise.
An Instruct command clearly documents phone reminders and consistent pill-organizer use as adherence counseling.
HPI records denial of ankle/foot swelling and presence of fatigue, satisfying side-effect review in correct section.
No Assessment/Plan entry for hypertension with adherence issue or continuation plan was provided.
No prescription, dosage change, or additional medication commands were issued; no unsupported therapy changes.
Notes are succinct without duplicated demographics or irrelevant details; minimal verbosity.
Commands correctly use HPI and Instruct sections without conflicts, but missing an Assess entry lowers completeness.
